clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Laparoscopic Sleeve Gastrectomy in the Morbidly Obese, Kidney Transplant Candidate
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Clinical Study of the Effect of Bariatric Surgery, Laparoscopic Sleeve Gastrectomy, on the Pharmacokinetics of Immunosuppressive Drugs in the Morbidly Obese, Kidney Transplant Candidate

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective clinical trial will study the effects of laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy in the potential renal transplant candidate who is denied acceptance due mainly to the morbid obesity.

detailed_description.textblock: The remaining factor in determining the effectiveness of bariatric surgery in the transplant population will be to study the effect on the pharmacokinetics of immunosuppressive medication, height, weight, BMI, abdominal circumference, blood pressure, Hba1c , average daily insulin requirements, lipid profile, TSH, 24h urine creatinine clearance and the SF-36 Quality of life questionnaire.

primary_outcome.measure: changes in the pharmacokinetics of oral immunosuppressive medications due to bariatric surgery, comparing pre-bariatric surgery to 12 months post-operative
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-bariatric surgery and 1 year after surgery

primary_outcome.measure: degree of weight loss achieved after bariatric surgery in the chronic renal failure patient.
primary_outcome.description: weight, BMI and abdominal circumference measures

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the change in general quality of life score, SF-36
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 1 year after bariatric surgery
primary_outcome.description: comparison of the SF score between Baseline and month 3, Baseline and month 6 and Baseline and month 12

secondary_outcome.measure: evaluate changes to residual renal function in the pre-dialysis renal transplant candidate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline versus month 12 post-bariatric surgery
secondary_outcome.description: serum creatinine/ urea, sodium, potassium, magnesium, calcium, phosphate and bicarbonate pre surgery and month 12

secondary_outcome.measure: evaluate the change in the number and dose of medications required to treat co-morbidities including, hypertension, hyperlipidemia and diabetes mellitus
secondary_outcome.description: concommitant medication records at baseline vs month 12

secondary_outcome.measure: the incidence of complications post-bariatric surgery will be evaluated
secondary_outcome.description: non serious and serious adverse events collection at Baseline, month 6 and month 12

arm_group.description: adult patients (> 18 years) who have stage 4 or 5 chronic renal disease (CrCl < 30 ml/min) who are being considered for possible future kidney transplantation. The study inclusion criteria are an indication for laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy (BMI > 40 kg/m2, or BMI > 35 with at least one co-morbidity such as hypertension, dyslipidemia or diabetes)

study_pop.textblock: morbidly obese, kidney transplant candidate with stage IV or V chronic renal disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult (>18 years)
- stage IV and V chronic renal disease (glomerular filtration rate < 30 ml/min,
- body mass index (BMI) of greater than 40 kg/m2 or > 35 with at least one co-morbidity such as hypertension, dyslipidemia or diabetes
Exclusion Criteria:
- medically unfit for surgical intervention
- previous gastric or intestinal surgery
- active gastric disease
- pregnancy or lactation
- known intolerance to tacrolimus or mycophenolic acid
- awaiting potential multi-organ transplantation
- active infection
